intro: Eribroma, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that resemble butterflies in shape. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Eribroma is native to parts of Asia and is often found in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and ease of cultivation.
